text: president putin announced another
meeting with his foreign minister sergey
lavrov and his Defense Minister Sergei
shoigu
as you say David three agreements have
been signed one between the Syrian
government and the Syrian rebels about a
ceasefire the second agreement about the
the nuts and bolts of that ceasefire how
to monitor how to ensure that it remains
intact and the third agreement about the
start of peace talks in Astana the
capital of Kazakhstan President Putin
said that this deal was fragile
he said attention had to be given to it
to make sure it remained in force but he
called upon the the Syrian government's
the Syrian rebels and all countries in
the region who were involved in this
conflict he said to back the deal and to
take part in peace talks he said that
this was the moment that Russia had been
waiting for and had been working hard to
achieve he praised the defense ministry
and the foreign ministry of his country
for bringing this about and working with
Moscow's partners in the region and this
is being certainly presented as a as a
Russian coup a diplomatic coup certainly
Russia has been criticized over the last
few months for its military operation in
Syria the Russian military has been
accused of war crimes by some Western
governments in and around Aleppo but
today is the day when President Putin
says to the world look I have delivered
on a plate a diplomatic solution to the
Syrian conflict now whether he can pull
this off whether this works is another
matter but certainly today the Russians
are saying look we have said that we are
looking for peace and Syria this is the
way we're going to do it we've managed
to get these agreements signed and the
other thing he said is now Russia is
going to reduce the number of its troops
in Syria although he did add that the
Russians would continue to fight
international terrorism and to help the
Syrian government fight terrorism yeah I
mean that's quite a statement isn't it
to talk about reducing Russia's military
presence now when we
the stage where of course there are
exclusions to this aren't there
so-called is al-nusra they're not party
to this deal at all but that suggests
that mr. Putin really does see this as a
definitive moment possibly although we
have to say David we have heard
President Putin talking before about
mission accomplished reduction of
Russian troop numbers in Syria I think
he said that in in March of this year
and in fact Russian troops remained in
in Syria and Russia's military operation
continued so there's no doubt that the
Russians will maintain their presence at
the mayim airbase their main air base in
Syria and in their naval base in Tartus
this is not the end of Russia's military
operation the other interesting thing I
think from this meeting that was shown
on Russian television between Putin and
his ministers was that Sergei Lavrov the
foreign minister said that now is the
moment to include other players in the
region like Saudi Arabia like Qatar like
Iraq and Jordan to bring these countries
to the negotiating table in Kazakhstan
no mention of the Obama administration
he did say though that when Donald
Trump's administration takes over in the
United States then he hoped that the US
would would join this peace effort but
certainly the message coming from Moscow
by not mentioning at all John Kerry of
John Kerry's efforts to bring peace to
Syria or President Obama is that this is
a big snub I think for the current
administration in in the United States
